intro: Chamomilla officinalis, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, hairy leaves. Its flowers are harvested when fully open to extract the essential oils, which are used in herbal medicine. Chamomilla officinalis is valued for its calming properties and is commonly used in teas and aromatherapy.
